intro: Eizaguirrea sonchifolia, commonly known as the Canary Islands groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
